definition: a piece of cloth or leather : rag
a blow especially with the hand, a hard hit in baseball
examples: When she was naughty, she would get a clout from her mother.

definition: a white cloth on a stake or frame used as a target in archery

examples: She parlayed her box-office clout to wealth and independence

definition: to cover or patch with a clout
examples: clouted his worn-out shoe with a piece of leather
He clouted 19 home runs last year.
He clouted him on the back of the head.
